channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Drivers vs. Cyclists: A Battle for the Streets in Canada’s Largest City
item.description: Cyclists in Toronto are resisting a law that would have the city rip out miles of bike lanes, setting back efforts toward safer streets.

item.title: Right-Wing Influencers Say Ghislaine Maxwell Is Key to Unlocking Epstein Case
item.description: Some conservative influencers have celebrated the move to approach the longtime associate of Jeffrey Epstein, but it comes with risks.

item.title: 11 People Injured in Stabbing at a Michigan Walmart, Officials Say
item.description: One person was in custody after what the authorities said was a random attack at a store near Traverse City, Mich.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia Trade Fire Despite Cease-Fire Promises
item.description: President Trump said on Saturday that both countries had agreed to a halt in the fighting. But on Sunday morning, skirmishes erupted once more.

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia Trade Fire Despite Cease-Fire Promises
item.description: President Trump said on Saturday that both countries had agreed to a halt in the fighting. But on Sunday morning, skirmishes erupted once more.

item.title: Trump Says He Expects Quick Cease-Fire Between Thailand and Cambodia
item.description: President Trump said he had intervened to help stop the deadly strife, now in its third day, after it extended to provinces about 200 miles south of w...

item.title: Taiwan Recall Campaign Fizzles, in a Setback to Its President
item.description: An unprecedented vote to remove lawmakers from office could have handed President Lai Ching-te more power by ousting opponents. It didn’t.

item.title: If I Don’t Post About My Vacation on Instagram, Did It Even Happen?
item.description: I know that craving the high of posting, of all those comments and hearts, is lame, but leaving is really hard.

item.title: Trump’s Trip to Scotland Echoes an Earlier Visit, When He Applauded Brexit
item.description: Before his 2016 election, President Trump correctly predicted that the forces animating Brexit would go beyond the United Kingdom. But now most Briton...

item.title: Drivers vs. Cyclists: A Battle for the Streets in Canada’s Largest City
item.description: Cyclists in Toronto are resisting a law that would have the city rip out miles of bike lanes, setting back efforts toward safer streets.

item.title: The Tea app was intended to help women date safely. Then hackers leaked 72,000 images online, including users’ selfies
item.description: No email addresses or phone numbers were exposed, the company said, and the breach only affects users who signed up before February 2024.

item.title: Allianz Life says hackers accessed personal data on the majority of its 1.4 million US customers
item.description: Allianz Life said the data breach happened on July 16 when a “malicious threat actor” accesses a third-party, cloud-based system used by the company.

item.title: Here’s how the Federal Reserve funds itself, including renovations, without taxpayer dollars
item.description: Unlike the Pentagon and a new weapons system that has blown through its budget, the Fed and its operations are funded differently.

item.title: US-Japan trade deal gives Trump control over $550 billion in investments. It could be ‘vapor ware’ — and a model for other countries
item.description: Analysts at Bank of America said that the Japan deal "looks like a reasonable blueprint" for other auto-exporting countries like South Korea.

item.title: US health, tech officials to launch data-sharing plan
item.description: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and CMS Administrator Mehmet Oz are expected to host executives at an event on Wednesday.
